intro: Phyteuma tetramerum, commonly known as the four-lobed phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats and produces showy, violet-colored blooms. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Phyteuma tetramerum is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
